t: Numbers 23
Then*p Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
And*p Balak did just as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered a bull and a ram on each*i altar.
Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps the Lord*s will come to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” So he went to a desolate height.
And God met Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered on each*i altar a bull and a ram.”
Then*p the Lord*s put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
So he returned to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, he and all the princes of Moab.
And*p he took up his oracle and said: “Balak*pn the king of Moab has brought me from Aram, From*ld the mountains of the east. ‘Come,*ld curse Jacob for me, And*ld come, denounce Israel!’
“How*ln shall I curse whom God has not cursed? And*ld how shall I denounce whom*i the Lord*s has not denounced?
For*ld from the top of the rocks I see him, And*ld from the hills I behold him; There!*ld A people dwelling alone, Not*ld reckoning itself among the nations.
“Who*ln can count the dust of Jacob, Or*ld number one-fourth of Israel? Let*ld me die the death of the righteous, And*ld let my end be like his!”
Then*p Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and look, you have blessed them*i bountifully!”
So*p he answered and said, “Must I not take heed to speak what the Lord*s has put in my mouth?”
Balaam’s Second Prophecy
Then*p Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from which you may see them; you shall see only the outer part of them, and shall not see them all; curse them for me from there.”
So he brought him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on each*i altar.
And*p he said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offering while I meet the*i Lord*is over there.”
Then*p the Lord*s met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, “Go back to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
So he came to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab were with him. And Balak said to him, “What has the Lord*s spoken?”
Then*p he took up his oracle and said: “Rise*pn up, Balak, and hear! Listen*ld to me, son of Zippor!
“God*ln is*i not a man, that He should lie, Nor*ld a son of man, that He should repent. Has*ld He said, and will He not do? Or*ld has He spoken, and will He not make it good?
Behold,*ld I have received a*i command*i to bless; He*ld has blessed, and I cannot reverse it.
“He*ln has not observed iniquity in Jacob, Nor*ld has He seen wickedness in Israel. The*ld Lord*s his God is*i with him, And*ld the shout of a King is*i among them.
God*ld brings them out of Egypt; He*ld has strength like a wild ox.
“For*ln there*i is*i no sorcery against Jacob, Nor*ld any divination against Israel. It*ld now must be said of Jacob And*ld of Israel, ‘Oh, what God has done!’
Look,*ld a people rises like a lioness, And*ld lifts itself up like a lion; It*ld shall not lie down until it devours the prey, And*ld drinks the blood of the slain.”
Then*p Balak said to Balaam, “Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all!”
So*p Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not tell you, saying, ‘All that the Lord*s speaks, that I must do’?”
Balaam’s Third Prophecy
Then*p Balak said to Balaam, “Please come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that overlooks the wasteland.
Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me here seven altars, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on every*i altar.
